meanings.definition: A place where aircraft regularly land and take off, equipped with facilities for passengers.
meanings.sent1: The small airpost in our town has a runway for planes to land.
meanings.sent2: We arrived at the airpost early to catch our flight.
meanings.sent3: The airpost was so busy that the passengers had to wait in line for a long time.
meanings.sent4: The airpost was a hive of activity, with planes coming and going constantly.
meanings.sent5: The airpost was bustling with travelers eager to reach their destinations.

meanings.definition: To send or receive mail or packages by air.
meanings.sent1: We need to airpost this package to ensure it arrives on time.
meanings.sent2: She decided to airpost the letter to her friend who lived far away.
meanings.sent3: I airposted the gift to my grandma so she would receive it before her birthday.
meanings.sent4: He airposted the important documents to the office to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The company always airposts their products to international customers for quick delivery.
